title: Agent-to-Polecat mapping: spawn polecats with BMAD agent personas
description: Parse BMAD agent YAML files (mayor/rig/src/modules/bmm/agents/*.agent.yaml) and spawn polecats with their personas. Each BMAD agent defines: metadata (name, title, icon), persona (role, identity, communication_style, principles), and menu triggers. Map these to polecat spawn parameters so GT can create workers with BMAD personalities.
close_reason: Implemented gt-bmad spawn command with BMAD agent persona injection

title: Phase orchestration: coordinate handoffs between phases/agents
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Coordinate handoffs between BMAD phases and agents. BMAD has 4 phases: Analysis, Planning, Solutioning, Implementation. Different agents handle different phases (Analyst -> PM -> Architect -> Dev). Build orchestration to hand off work between phases, spawn appropriate agents, and maintain workflow continuity.
close_reason: Implemented phase orchestration with gt-bmad-phase command and bmad-project formula

title: Workflow dispatch: gt workflow run <agent> <trigger> command
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Create gt workflow command to execute BMAD workflows by agent trigger. Usage: gt workflow run <agent> <trigger>. Agent menu items define triggers (e.g., 'DS' for dev-story, 'BP' for brainstorm-project) that map to workflow files. Command should load agent, fuzzy-match trigger, and execute corresponding workflow.

title: Workflow beads: track workflow state as beads
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Track BMAD workflow execution state as beads instead of frontmatter. BMAD workflows use step files with sequential execution and state tracking. Convert this to bead-based tracking: create bead when workflow starts, update as steps complete, close when workflow finishes. Enables cross-session workflow continuity.
